data.text:
It may not always make the headlines but the UN works all over the world to prevent conflict and keep peace & stability.

See how the UN makes a difference in the lives of everyone, everywhere: https://t.co/jWlwtqFDD5 #UN75 https://t.co/RvRmXDf6dQ

Yemen is suffering the world's worst humanitarian crisis, driven by conflict, disease and poverty.

@WFP is providing food assistance to more than 1/3 of the country's population. See how you can help. https://t.co/shPsYXqrwV https://t.co/L3Vp66UvuU

"Don't treat this virus lightly. It is dangerous."

-- @davidnabarro, special envoy of the @WHO dismantles dangerous misinformation about #coronavirus & shares what the SARS & Ebola responses can teach us about fighting #COVID19.

https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/lZmF9alHP8

Foreign interference growing
Thousands fleeing their homes
#COVID19 cases on the rise

"Time is not on our side in Libya," @antonioguterres warned UN Security Council on Wednesday. 

https://t.co/nzy2esIOyk

33% of countries are now welcoming visitors to their #WorldHeritage sites, compared to just 10% in April, due to #COVID19.

Check out the latest from @UNESCO. https://t.co/mfm8DM20iE https://t.co/ra9Rdoqms2

In these difficult times, people around the world are coming together & finding strength in unity.

Get inspired with our new @Twitter moment. https://t.co/zlwoRzXcJb

📚 Learning
👩‍🚀 Dreaming
🪁 Playing

That's what all kids should do. But 108 million girls & boys are trapped in child labour around the 🌏. 
Here's what @FAO is doing to #EndChildLabour: https://t.co/5EUku4Ty8V
 
https://t.co/8NbfsuyakA

Burkina Faso's first polio vaccination campaign has been carried out since mass immunization efforts were suspended in March due to #COVID19. 

@WHOAFRO trained health workers on how to safely carry out the campaign amid the pandemic. https://t.co/7Pnb7JIde9 #VaccinesWork https://t.co/TnOU5kfhh6

Indigenous people are 3 times more likely to live in extreme poverty compared to non-indigenous populations. 

@UNDP highlights the social & economic inequalities that affect indigenous communities in the face of #COVID19 in Latin America. https://t.co/8zJYEMovfB

The #COVID19 pandemic has pushed more than 250 million people to the brink of starvation, @UNHumanRights expert warns.

New strategies, greater empowerment & accountability needed to tackle pervasive poverty & inequalities. https://t.co/i79IxgFPll https://t.co/OtpwLhmgFQ

.@unpeacekeeping operations are among the UN’s most signficant achievements, and a powerful tool to protect & promote human rights. They need resources – and your strong political support.

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet to UN Security Council.
https://t.co/92oecrwUln

The #COVID19 pandemic has unleashed an unprecedented crisis, slowing the progress of #GlobalGoals & disproportionately affecting the world’s poorest & most vulnerable.

New @UNDESA #SDGReport: https://t.co/KS8bkNiy5q https://t.co/gG19c8bu49

Syria: Children, women & men have endured unfathomable suffering and continue to be indiscriminately attacked & targeted.

New @UNCoISyria report finds war crimes committed by all sides during the brutal & long running conflict. https://t.co/2NIiyvDKwn

It's easy to share misinformation if you're not paying attention. 

So, pause & take your time to make sure you are sharing accurate & factual information. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/VoSvHaFlbb

"We can’t go back to the way things were before the pandemic. The UN is strongly committed to leading a fairer, more sustainable renewal."

-- @antonioguterres on UN's #COVID19 response. https://t.co/1U1xBexc6M https://t.co/27OkjQpMUe

Privacy issues, cyberbullying, grooming and sexual exploitation & abuse are some of the risks children are facing online.

@ITU is working to help cultivate a healthy & empowering online environment. https://t.co/Y7qr9dOpiP https://t.co/eWcR3Wbzbs

#ClimateAction is important, even during the #COVID19 crisis. 

Using a refillable bottle reduces plastic waste, which helps save energy & reduce CO2 emissions. See how you can #ActNow to protect our planet. https://t.co/xN4WUQCWNL https://t.co/YVI4KJPRln

Despite remarkable progress, global HIV targets set for 2020 will not be met due to unequal access to treatments, leaving millions at risk.

More from new @UNAIDS report: https://t.co/AhBvXT2sbK https://t.co/wj9yDHYiAu

"We must accelerate coordinated global action to ensure that we recover better from this crisis."

-- @antonioguterres ahead of this week's virtual global forum to assess progress towards the #GlobalGoals. 

#COVID19

https://t.co/e846wo96WJ

Through the Trust Fund in Support of Victims of Sexual Exploitation and Abuse, the UN works with community-based networks to identify victims and offer further support. 

More from @UNPeacekeeping https://t.co/h2hrYUOC8N #HonouringOurValues https://t.co/ArSBTRgwYS

Rise in zoonotic diseases are caused by: 
🥩Increased demand for meat products
🌱Unsustainable farming
🐯Exploitation of wildlife
🔥Climate crisis

New @UNEP & @ILRI report has steps governments can take to prevent future pandemics like #COVID19. https://t.co/vgvg0Z3EbE https://t.co/Vht6yc5o0D

The needs of women & girls must be integrated into #COVID19 responses for stronger economies & societies for everyone. 

New @UN_Women Data Hub compiles indicators that can help inform gender-responsive policy actions. https://t.co/IvYrPGOBnz
Virtual counter-terrorism week to explore challenges of addressing threat of terrorism amid #COVID19 pandemic. Full programme: https://t.co/7wecws2rUd via @UN_OCT https://t.co/VdP2FXC6Xc

Amid #COVID19, we must stand in solidarity with everyone in our communities, including migrants.

@UNMigration works to ensure migrants everywhere are included in the #coronavirus response & their basic rights are protected. https://t.co/fGSF1aWgU6 https://t.co/0nTcNmrElq

As domestic violence reports surge during the #COVID19 pandemic, information & support services must be made available to women & girls, particularly those with disabilities. #ShadowPandemic https://t.co/5tkho3FFwZ via @UN_Women https://t.co/5KkLz6mkxI

Hate speech, stigma, discrimination & xenophobia are all on the rise as a result of #COVID19.

Here's how the UN is working to #StandUp4HumanRights & promote solidarity during the pandemic.

https://t.co/Gx6EK75sAT

Ensuring healthy lives & promoting well-being at all ages is essential for a better world.

The UN supplies vaccines for about half of the world’s children, helping to save 3 million lives a year. https://t.co/jWlwtqXf1F #UN75 https://t.co/mZrPdvPYTJ

Misinformation is spreading faster than #COVID19 itself, disrupting public health efforts & distorting sound scientific guidance.

We can all take action now to prevent the spread of misinformation. Pause and #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/gwBuorAnvq

Traditional crops can:

🍌 enrich diets
🌱 safeguard agriculture
🌏 beat the climate crisis at its own game

@FAO has more on the #FutureOfFood: https://t.co/asf2T0g99X

"Ending the pandemic in Africa is essential for ending it across the world."

-- @antonioguterres stresses the need for solidarity with African countries amid the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/RysDzikF9w https://t.co/rbCO66xJlB

Sustainable gastronomy can support:

🌽 agricultural development
🥘 food security
🍎 nutrition
👩‍🌾 👨‍🌾 sustainable food production & 
🌱 conservation of biodiversity.

@UNEP has ideas on how you can take part in healthier, more sustainable food systems. https://t.co/V1nDA3yc8K

The climate crisis affects everyone, everywhere.

As the UN marks its 75th anniversary, @UNEP takes a look back at some of the UN's most important #ClimateAction milestones and reflects on its work to protect our planet. https://t.co/V3zcSNvBhu #UN75 https://t.co/neVFPtYT3m

Lots of misinformation about #COVID19 contains a grain of truth.

Journalist & researcher @_FelixSimon_ talks about how facts about the #coronavirus can get distorted.

https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/SNgoz3NVO4

Around the world, @UNVolunteers are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic.

We thank them for their dedication & indispensable efforts. https://t.co/HDZRJOwn1Y https://t.co/BdEtmOVSvw

For millions of farmers, the #COVID19 pandemic poses a significant threat to their way of life.  

@IFAD is scaling up its support for farmers, who play an invaluable role in keeping exports flowing & protecting the world's food supply. https://t.co/MVfGl2o5Qv

#COVID19 has demonstrated the interconnected nature of our world – and that no one is safe until everyone is safe.  

Only by acting in solidarity can communities save lives & recover from the #coronavirus crisis.

https://t.co/oAJhpGr0EH

Being away from school & other activities during #COVID19 may isolate children from support networks, limiting their ability to disclose abuse & seek help.

@UNICEF is working to protect vulnerable children during the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/WLIblqZEoW https://t.co/aVp0GgBCC5

Like many countries across the world, Afghanistan is facing challenges due to the #COVID19 crisis.

In Kabul, 80+ @UNVolunteers serving with @UNAMAnews are working to help keep communities safe. We thank them for their efforts! https://t.co/zLrxVBMvQP https://t.co/c4lGGfgFxQ

.@UNMAS & partners turn minefields into playing fields, helping to create #SafeGround.

Mine action supports communities & inspires survivors to reclaim their lives. https://t.co/a25LiU2Kv6 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/CiCIWHUT6G

Cooperatives employ more than 279 million people - 10% of the total working population across the 🌏.

More on Saturday's #CoopsDay. https://t.co/dfrDNJ4Rqv https://t.co/g3BH4tmwTf

Amid the #COVID19 crisis, universal, reliable & affordable digital networks are key for sharing life-saving health information. 

More investments are needed to close the digital divide for people who remain offline during the pandemic. https://t.co/1Ll4VLqWxJ #GlobalGoals https://t.co/4vyQxUYXsj

Cooperatives create opportunities for livelihoods & income generation. 

Learn more on Saturday's #CoopsDay: https://t.co/yCJyfxgYJc #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Jg57Pdc5JM

The world is witnessing record-high levels of displacement.

Every day, the UN works to provide protection for 82.5 million people fleeing war, famine and persecution. https://t.co/jWlwtqFDD5 #UN75 https://t.co/IKZQ3XG03l

If people take just a few moments to pause, to think about it, before reflexively sharing, it can go a long way to stop the spread of misinformation.

-- UN global communications chief @MelissaFleming on @NBCLX. https://t.co/xKr4r7Pf4Y #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/kjF55PzVbH

#COVID19 is disproportionately affecting indigenous people.

@UNHumanRights calls on countries to take into account the unique needs of indigenous communities in their #coronavirus response. https://t.co/ZZY2PcUKza https://t.co/lhnDSkXHbQ

#COVID19 knows no boundaries -- it affects everyone, everywhere. 

Check out our new @Twitter moment to see how the UN is working around the world to ensure people continue receiving the help they need during the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/2Zd7gpOkkW

What we share online can have consequences in the real world. 

Take a moment to pause - and #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/7uzlaYZrw9

Women have been disproportionately affected by #COVID19.

@ILO warns that crisis could result in a backslide on progress made for gender equality & exacerbate inequalities in the labour market. https://t.co/y3hYxKWaM2 https://t.co/QJEcjLIAqZ

Pests and diseases destroy up to 40% of food crops every year.

During the International Year of #PlantHealth, we can all inspire change & raise awareness about the importance of healthy plants! https://t.co/33mSYgVY39 via @FAO #IYPH2020 https://t.co/CKYx1tUdaG

Since the beginning of #COVID19, the UN has mounted a comprehensive response — providing medical & material support, advocating for a global economic rescue package, & offering analysis on key areas of the crisis.

-- @antonioguterres to Security Council. https://t.co/AnEeWcrZoS https://t.co/mWUHkGYv46

Youth unemployment is on the rise, worsened by the #COVID19 crisis.

@UNDESA's #WorldYouthReport explores how social entrepreneurship can create employment opportunities & help achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/dbebVwMaIl https://t.co/A6kwfrpDvc

Now - more than ever,
your voice matters,
your ideas matter. 

Share your solutions for a better future, as the UN marks 75 years of working on behalf of people everywhere.

https://t.co/mcajceBlG8  #UN75 https://t.co/NAU6M3tT4f

The #COVID19 pandemic is an economic, humanitarian, security & human rights crisis. 

Learn more about how the UN is fighting #coronavirus to save lives, protect societies, recover better. https://t.co/u8vZwDq0Zq https://t.co/GFL65cDi0B

10 years ago, @UN_Women was formed to advance the rights of women & girls around the world. 

From the #COVID19 response to women's political empowerment to protecting girls in conflict, see how its work has changed the world over the last decade. https://t.co/KdBIXq6SWY https://t.co/2ZjAlKQYn2

Nurses
doctors
sanitation workers
truck drivers
grocery store workers
researchers
& all essential workers

are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

We thank them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic.

🎨: Ruby Wang https://t.co/JI10HGCidk

Millions of people rely on @Wikipedia for information.

Hear from Clinical Neuroscientist Dr @nethahussain on what it's like updating Wiki pages on #COVID19.

https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/Dm2ZlyuFfh

UN Security Council unanimously supports @antonioguterres' call for a global ceasefire to enable delivery of lifesaving aid amid the #COVID19 pandemic.

https://t.co/RdjRitBHZc

"All humans have the right to thrive with dignity and freedom from racism and discrimination in all its forms."

-- @aminajmohammed on the need to protect the equality, human rights and dignity of all people. https://t.co/XGS1BPkIp8 https://t.co/Hm66Cs7Kt6

Women's rights are human rights!

For a decade, @UN_Women has been working for gender quality & women's empowerment.

On their 10th anniversary, learn more about their efforts to protect & promote the rights of women & girls everywhere. https://t.co/SHg6BIPMEq #GenerationEquality https://t.co/IDcSxdJU4Y

100,000+ people have already expressed their support for: 

Peace
Human rights
Equality 
Dignity for all

Join them by adding your image to photo filters that show values of the UN Charter & celebrate our 75th birthday! 

https://t.co/tqFgLnP2vH #UN75 https://t.co/Uo8NReWPtJ

Misinformation manipulates your emotions.

Tommy Shane from @firstdraftnews explains the power of pausing before you share online.

https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/jp3oIEJAmi

New world records for extreme 'megaflash' lightning, lasting 16.7 sec and stretching 700 km, more than doubled the previous record flashes, says @WMO.

Find out where it struck & how to stay safe:
https://t.co/JnodppQ7c5

Iran nuclear deal remains the best way to ensure exclusively peaceful nature of its nuclear programme.

-- UN political chief @DicarloRosemary to Security Council on Tuesday.

https://t.co/Vzs1GZBSdm

As Syria enters its 10th year of conflict, the international community pledged $7.7 billion to allow the UN and its partners to keep providing life-saving assistance in the country, where 11 million people need emergency aid just to survive. #SyriaConf2020
https://t.co/tW2g2GlNb4
On Tuesday's #SocialMediaDay, see how the world is uniting to help stop the spread of #COVID19 misinformation and urging digital users to #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. https://t.co/Mf85dcekZm

Misinformation is dangerous & can hamper our ability to make progress on global issues.

On Tuesday's #SocialMediaDay, we launched "Pause" — a campaign that asks everyone to take time to think about what you share online. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare.

https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/71VxfAW7OZ

#COVID19 threatens progress made in ending harmful practices, such as female genital mutilation & child marriage.  

Join @UNFPA to help protect women & girls against lasting trauma that threatens their right to reach their full potential. https://t.co/DLINfbm7Q4 #AgainstMyWill https://t.co/7qMYCY9Y2B

Only 25% of the world's members of parliament are women.

On Tuesday’s #WorldParliamentDay & every day, @IPUparliament works to promote gender parity in parliaments. https://t.co/f8B9dXVntc

"I am deeply concerned that even the most minimalist form of annexation would lead to increased violence and loss of life." 

-- @mbachelet urges Israel not to proceed with its plans to annex a swathe of occupied Palestinian territory. https://t.co/y2p1tXvpVd via @UNHumanRights
Misinformation spreads faster when we’re upset. Pause and #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. https://t.co/y5YYs3T2aJ
On Tuesday's #AsteroidDay, see how @UNOOSA works to help identify & counter asteroid impact hazards: https://t.co/L8Xscmuuuq https://t.co/2nhYrA7OhY

"People who have struggled through 9 years of devastating conflict are telling us that they have now reached breaking point."

-- @UNReliefChief to UN Security Council ahead of Tuesday's #SyriaConf2020. https://t.co/C7y9Wv9fSo

"Parliaments have a special duty to advance human rights and promote sustainable development. More than ever, the #COVID19 pandemic reminds us of these vital tasks.”

-- @antonioguterres’ on Tuesday’s #WorldParliamentDay.  https://t.co/zzuSdM0hkx https://t.co/XzWSdkm5E6
On Tuesday's #AsteroidDay, learn more about the importance of international cooperation when it comes to the risks posed by asteroids: https://t.co/RTi67u8fJZ https://t.co/cXZ3oIqGZi

Every woman has the right to sexual & reproductive health, and to decide freely and responsibly without coercion or violence.

Rights to sexual & reproductive health are essential for the well-being of women & girls. More from @UNFPA: https://t.co/GvUbIGZGh4 https://t.co/4ULOiRaORC

During these difficult times, there are things we can all do to show solidarity with the people in our communities & others around the world.

See inspiring examples of unity in our latest @Twitter moment. https://t.co/Gl40TF8J6s

Millions more people will be pushed into food insecurity due to #COVID19.

@WFP is responding with a $ 4.9 billion appeal to undertake the biggest humanitarian response in its history. https://t.co/ZNn7vY0pIH https://t.co/EbQCYPl9ZK

UN Mine Action (@UNMAS) & partners turn minefields into playing fields, helping to create #SafeGround.

More on their efforts to bring communities together through sports and make a better & safer world for all: https://t.co/dkspptZVRU #GlobalGoals https://t.co/z35H41GeyO

More than 1% of the world population — nearly 79.5 million people — were displaced as a result of persecution, conflict, violence, or human rights violations at the end of 2019. 

More facts in latest @Refugees Global Trends report: https://t.co/HsV5WgUurG https://t.co/dZVd4qdQOu

In Bazumburu, South Sudan, children were forced to attend lessons outside due to their classrooms being destroyed by conflict.

Now they are studying in a newly-built school thanks to @unmissmedia, allowing learners to grow and reach their full potential. https://t.co/xADXVfXoCO https://t.co/oXKIQAMxJi

The Tropics have high levels of poverty, with more people undernourished than in the rest of the 🌏.

On Monday's #TropicsDay, find out what tropical nations are doing to achieve the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/MKeSAYNXlk https://t.co/OhbR2FnXGK

Recovering from the #coronavirus crisis will require a global approach driven by compassion & solidarity

The UN Comprehensive Response to #COVID19 aims to save lives, protect societies, recover better. https://t.co/1U1xBefAIc

The Tropics host 80% of the world’s biodiversity - and face severe challenges - including the climate crisis, deforestation, urbanization & demographic shifts. 

Monday is #TropicsDay. https://t.co/aThJhi5W74 https://t.co/Fg8U5ESf77

Before, during and after childbirth, all women have the right to high quality care. 

New @WHO antenatal care guidelines aim to help countries ensure a positive pregnancy experience for all women and improve maternal health. https://t.co/RtRDVcJXo8 https://t.co/gk1JDhkCp5

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love. 

❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

As #PrideMonth comes to end, see how you can continue supporting UN @free_equal all year round in the fight against transphobia & homophobia: https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag https://t.co/2CvJObWS73

#COVID19 is providing businesses an opportunity to move toward a safer, greener & more resilient global economy.

The UN is supporting corporate partners as they seek ways to build back better & support the #GlobalGoals.
https://t.co/PXPT4C9bY1

We are in this together - and we will get through this, together.

The UN is working around the clock to help everyone, everywhere in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/3EHAHjd0ND

🎨: Giulia Corti https://t.co/hxb1E41jtF

Yemen: A failing health system & the spread of #COVID19 have put millions at risk in the country.

Here's what you need to know about how the UN is helping those trapped in the world's largest humanitarian crisis. via @UNOCHA

https://t.co/MtI6dHimMj

After #COVID19, many children will face learning & social challenges when it comes to returning to school. 

Targeted efforts can help ensure a smoother transition for learners, particularly the most vulnerable. via @UNICEF 
https://t.co/wprE0Z3GDs

In the past year, 243 million women and girls experienced sexual or physical violence by an intimate partner. 

During the #COVID19 response, we must ensure support services are considered ‘essential services’ and kept open. https://t.co/RfPrxMH3u9 via @UN_Women #ShadowPandemic https://t.co/bXbyQ168UQ

"#COVID19 continues to devastate lives and livelihoods around the globe — hitting the most vulnerable the hardest."

@antonioguterres highlights need to protect refugees & migrants amid the #coronavirus crisis and recover better for the benefit of all. https://t.co/dpybH2cX6T https://t.co/heEjgEmncJ

"Every day, in our work across the world, we strive to do our part to promote inclusion, justice, dignity and combat racism in all its forms."

-- @antonioguterres on the UN's work to #StandUp4HumanRights and end racism & racial discrimination. https://t.co/QfR5x14GnL https://t.co/LV5o6p5Spc

"Women have nowhere to run."

-- Take a listen 🎧 to Zahara from Uganda as she explores how rural girls & women are suffering from physical & emotional abuse due to the economic collapse & lockdown from #COVID19.
https://t.co/QB9PyJkWa5

The #COVID19 recovery must include #ClimateAction policies & steps to advance the #GlobalGoals.

@UNDESA has solutions for building resilience against future crises by taking action for people & planet. https://t.co/E3DViZ4OrZ https://t.co/OagpeNVFHN

In the Central African Republic, 80+ artists have joined @UNPeacekeeping to raise public awareness about #COVID19 and say “NO” to stigmatization through art.

Their colourful murals 🎨 and educational songs 🎶 will help keep communities safe & healthy. https://t.co/mhffL0UkJs https://t.co/zUtXiKGkND

Small businesses have been particularly vulnerable to the repercussions of #COVID19.

On Saturday's #MSMEDay, more from @ITCNews on how micro, small & medium sized enterprises can recover from the crisis to be more resilient, inclusive & sustainable. https://t.co/Lp0Ufv0Nb1 https://t.co/ZVASusrgsO

Friday marked 75th anniversary of the signing of the United Nations Charter.

See how people around the world celebrated the creation of the UN & its tireless efforts to unite people to find solutions to the biggest challenges facing humanity. #UN75 https://t.co/XIN4ZreSUq
